title: Android 8.1 stuck on take secound picture/scan
body:
Tested on compiled app and on app from google play.

On phone with android 8.1 ( Motorola g5s ) first scan taking without issue, when taking secound one after first one we se a rolling circle and photo don't shoot. We need to enter gallery, go back to scaner and press once again and photo is done, when trying to take another we need go to gallery, go back and press photo, on Android 8.0 and lower everything working good.

### Steps to reproduce
Android 8.1
Open ONS, take scan, take secound scan ( stuck !), go to gallery, go back, take scan and it's working.

### Expected behaviour
Stuck on secound scan.
[ons_log.txt](https://github.com/ctodobom/OpenNoteScanner/files/2610065/ons_log.txt)

title: Add support for PNG metadata
label: [Label(name="Intended feature"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
Project now supports generating lossless PNG images, but this format isn't supported by ExifInterface methods.

Recently the folks that regulates the PNG format issued an standard for Exif tags on it, but I was unable to find any Android implementation for it, if somebody knows how to, help is wanted.

title: Fixes #120: Sharing does not work. Fix :  using FileProvider to avoid…
body:
… FileUriExposedException when sharing files.

This commit fixes an issue where sharing would cause a crash due to a [FileUriExposedException](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/FileUriExposedException) being thrown when using `"file://"+filepath` to share images instead of using a `FileProvider`.

Fixes #120

Following TG discussion I am attaching the logcat output created when opening the app and scanning a page.

title: OpenNoteScanner crashes upon completion of OpenCV Manager direct download
body:
As #130 mentions, OpenCV Manager is no longer available on the Play Store, so the direct download is the only option. However, choosing it causes the app itself to crash once the OCVM has been downloaded.

### Steps to reproduce
 - Install OpenNoteScanner from F-Droid
 - Run ONS
 - Select direct download from the Install OpenCV Manager prompt

### Expected behaviour
I should be asked to install OCVM after download completes.

### Actual behaviour
ONS crashes; Android prompts "Open Note Scanner has stopped"

### Would you like to work on the issue?
Depends on what I can do to debug it in the first place.

A short step-by-step guide or link where to find the OpenCV Manager APK would be helpful.

title: Request: (default) option save black and white documents as 1-bit PNGs
body:
First of all, thank you for making OpenNoteScanner! It's a wonderful app, and I use it regularly.

However, it saddens me a bit that the output is always a high-quality JPG, even though we really have a 1-bit B&W document. In that case, it makes a lot more sense to use PNG: it's lossless (so no worries about having to use a high quality JPG setting to avoid artifacts), and actually can use a 1-bit palette for better compression.

I can't share the files I scanned because they contain sensitive personal information, but basically, I just scanned 7 black and white documents, adding up to 8MiB JPGs.

After opening the files in GIMP, setting the colors to 1-bit black and white (no dithering) and re-exporting them as PNGs the total size was a mere 445 KiB, a 20x decrease in size without any loss in quality! And note how this whole process can be automatic.

Now, I know PNG encoders can be slow, but if you tell it to turn off [filtering algorithms](https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG-Filters.html) they usually get a lot faster (because they basically try compressing with different filters and keep the best option, leading to more work). Those filters are mostly for dealing with documents that have a lot of gradients, something that is absent in B&W images by definition, so there isn't really a big compression benefit to using them here anyway.

title: White & black mode: Always scans the whole picture
body:
Hi,

today I tried to scan in black&white with no post-processing, with flash, in manual mode. The green square was correctly placed over my paper (A4 size), when I clicked I had the message like "press again to scann the whole sheet", did *not* pressed again, and had the whole sheet scanned like 5 times in a raw. The green sqare was consistently finding the paper (white paper over grey surface). Had to switch back to color for the selection to work again.

I'm not sure I can reproduce the bug consistently, as I succeeded to scan one (a single one) sheet in white and black today, correctly framed.

title: Possibility to use from other apps
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi,
I am implementing an OCR application to recognize text in the image. I am already done with extracting and reading text from the image.

However, I can't extract only the document from the image. So the output of the recognized text is too random as that region/block of text can be anywhere in the clicked image.

If I could get only the document then I can be sure that certain block will have a specific text on every scan.

So I wanted to know if I can use OpenNoteScanner as a library?

This can be closed! 

Thank you!

title: Adding an Exif editor to tag and comment on scanned documents
body:
How about adding Exif editing to be able to add tags and comments to scanned files? JPEGs have meta data fields that can be used to store information about the scanned documents. Please look at android app "APhotoManager" on Github - https://github.com/k3b/APhotoManager/wiki/Exif-Edit   
Currently, APhotoManager can be used in conjunction with OpenNoteScanner but why not add this feature if it is not too difficult and it makes tagging more useful.

title: Logo proposal
body:
Hi @ctodobom Sir, I am a graphic designer and I want to contribute to your amazing project by proposing a new Logo/Icon design as i have noticed that the exisiting logo in my opinion needs an upgrade. If you liked it I will send you the files as a gift. Here is my design Sir..

design idea: I made a modern and clean design and it shows the combination of the Notes symbol with the Scanner idea that you will notice in the corners of the note. I also put the pencil in the design as a connection to the present logo used.


app icons

logotype A

logotype B

Thanks and Best regards!
Tobaloidee

title: Tagging feature not working in Open Note Scanner.
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
#### Expected behavior The app should be able to tags marked scans using the special page template. #### Actual behavior The app is not able to tag marked scans. The Tagging feature does not work and is not able to tag on scanned documents. #### How to reproduce + Launch the app. + Click on gallery icon. + Choose any scanned document. + Click on tagging feature. + Choose any tag. + There is not any tag on scanned document as the tagging feature not working. * Browser: Open Note scanner, version :1.0.29 * Operating system:Android Nought (7) Moto c plus #### Recording Of The Bug https://youtu.be/-_mz7Xl9gaQ
Posted on Utopian.io - Rewarding Open Source Contributors

title: [Clarification request] Better output image resolution and losslessly compressed images
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I wish to have

- better image resolution
- lossless images (png - not jpg, which is a lossy compression method and only for natural photos,not for fonts or writings)

What are your thoughts about these improvements?

title: [Question] Minimal camera parameters
body:
### 1. Summary

I get bad scan images in OpenNoteScanner. Text not readable.

Possible, it because camera of my smartphone is not good.

### 2. Environment

+ ARK Benefit S401,
+ CyanogenMod 12.1,
+ MergeVariables 1.0.29,
+ 2MP camera.

### 3. Steps to reproduce

I install MergeVariables via F-Droid → I install OpenCV Manager → I placed my white book to black fabric → I open MergeVariables → I take a photo of my book, use MergeVariables.

### 4. Expected behavior

Readable text.

### 5. Actual behavior

Example:

![OpenNoteScanner](https://i.imgur.com/RDtvfAG.jpg)

### 6. Not helped

I try in MergeVariables:

+ Color mode,
+ Image Processor,
+ Automatic mode,
+ Flash.

The image is not much improved.

Thanks.

title: Automatic Tagging feature not working in Open Note Scanner.
label: [Label(name="Intended feature")]
body:
#### Expected behavior The app should be able to tags marked scans automatically using the special page template. #### Actual behavior The app is not able to tag automatically on marked scans. The automatic Tagging does not work and is not able to tag automatically on scanned documents. #### How to reproduce + Launch the App. + Click on setting icon. + Click on Automatic Tagging. + Click on any tag. + Take photo of any document. + There is not any tag on scanned document as the automatic Tagging does not work. * Browser: Open Note Scanner * Operating system:Android Nought(7) moto C plus #### Recording Of The Bug https://youtu.be/V-egQkmjb7Q
Posted on Utopian.io - Rewarding Open Source Contributors

title: Add option to group scans and export them to PDF
body:
Ability to group some photos in one document would be useful and display them instead of single photos. 
Exporting these groups to PDF files also would be convenient for users.

title: Add ability to manually adjust geometry
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: It will be nice to implement ability to manually adjust geometry of photo like it is in CamScanner, for example when you have huge piece of paper with 2-3 lines of notes and you only want to scan them, not entire page.

title: can't focus -> unsharp/unreadable result
body:
I have a Samsung S5 mini with LineageOS. ONS Version 1.0.29 from f-droid

When taking pictures with the regular camera app, I can focus by tapping, and the resulting photo of the document is sharp and readable.

However, when using opennote scanner on the same document, taken from the same distance, it seems it is constantly trying to focus. Even after 10+ tries I'm unable to capture an image that is actually readable (always unfocusess/blurred).

I don't know if this autofocussing behaviour is a bug or a feature, but it would be nice if I could tap to focus.

title: Stays on when locking device
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: When I switch off my phone while the app is running, ONS stays running, causing considerable battery drain and heat. It should release the camera and stop when the device is locked.

title: feature request. Camera2 api integration
body:
Hi team,
In the source code the old "Camera Api" is used which is deprecated from android api 21. It will be best if you integrate "Camera2 Api" aswell.

title: Can only manually scan for document
body:
Maybe this is a simple usage problem, I'm not sure how to correctly take a picture.

App-behavior: Camera works, I can see the green outline once I turned automatic document detection on. The green button on the bottom tells me:
"Searching for document
Tap again to scan whole image"
Nothing else happens. Tried with preformated PDF, normal paper, tapping the green region, aso.
When I tap the green button again, the Image the image gets scanned, turned into contrast view, but no perspective-correction happens.

Using a Nexus 5X with Copperhead OS

title: Outdated changelog
body: Hi, Just wanted to point out that the changelog entry for 1.0.28 and 1.0.29 appears to be missing from https://github.com/ctodobom/OpenNoteScanner/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md

thanks.

title: Adapt "Share" intent from gallery to the number of selected documents
body:
The sharing button from the gallery view would always create an intent to share _multiple_ pictures, even when only one document is selected (issue #78).

Add a check for the number of selected documents: if there is only one, an intent to share only one picture is created. Thus, the same list of applications is displayed as in the full screen view.

This makes the behavior more consistent with the sharing button from the full screen view, and make it easier to export a scanned document from the gallery to other applications, e.g. PDF Creator.

title: Inconsistent share target between views
body:
The list of "Share" targets shown when hitting the button from the gallery view, is different from the list of targets available from the full screen scan view. In particular, the application [PDF Creator](https://github.com/scoute-dich/PDFCreator) does not show up (but it is not the only one, just the one that made me realize this issue).

As "Sharing" scans to PDF Creator can be really useful for PDF export, I believe it is important to fix this, because this bug prevents exporting multiple scans at once into a single PDF.

I can't say for sure that the problem does not actually come from the applications that do not appear in the "Share" targets of the gallery view.

title: Deleting the last image from gallery didn't close the activity.
body:
After deleting the last image, a empty image was displayed (white screen) instead of going back to the gallery. Pressing either **Delete** or **Tag** resulted in _IndexOutOfBoundsException_. 

Added a check which closes the activity when no more images are left.

title: (Colored) areas converted to (colored) edges
body:
Thanks for this great app! I'm really excited after finding it today. However, I noticed the postprocessing does some edge detection and this isn't a good solution for some (many?) notes as it loses colored areas by converting colored areas into just colored edges. Why is edge based postprocessing done?

Here's a scan without processing:

![without processing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2195834/26886553-5301a2d0-4bae-11e7-8e0e-6aa755da2394.jpg)

And here's a scan of the same document with postprocessing:

![with postprocessing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2195834/26886558-5606168c-4bae-11e7-9b64-84b7f87d85bd.jpg).

All the colored areas are lost and even the edges are hardly visible. Would it be possible to either offer an option to disable edge based postprocessing or disable it globally altogether?  I really would love to see a colored area as a colored area instead of just the edges of the area.

title: Flash doesn't turn on if locking the device
body: If the user locks the device while flashlight is turned on, it keeps on.

title: Don't animate icon when launched from intent
body: Prevent post-scan crash when launching from intent.

title: Fix and improve french translation
body:
Hello there,

First of all, thanks for this nice app, it's really usefull. I noticed some wording issues in the French translations, so here is my contribution.

It fixes some typos, and makes some sentences simpler and more understandable. It also translates some parts that were still in English.

Maybe @brenard will want to review this.

title: Slow Scan
body:
Open Note Scanner it's good, but it's very slow because you're trying to dynamically recognize images, before the photograph is taken - like the human brain does, which on not high end devices tends to be tediously slow. On the other hand, apps like CamScanner work blazing fast because they recognize a still image ( after photographing ) .... I'd request the devs to add an option for static image recognition.
Thank You.

title: Future request. Automatic sharing.
body:
like a RocketBook. 
For example, tag "Rocket" - sending image to e-mail.

title: Inefficient API is used
body:
Dear developers,

I found an inefficient API, setImageURI(), is used in OpenNoteScanner.

For setImageURI(), Google says this:
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/ImageView.html#setImageURI(android.net.Uri)
" This does Bitmap reading and decoding on the UI thread, which can cause a latency hiccup. If that's a concern, consider using setImageDrawable(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) or setImageBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap) and BitmapFactory instead. "

I noticed that in the following code, setImageURI() is used:
com.todobom.opennotescanner.views.TouchImageView.java   (line number: 181)
https://github.com/ctodobom/OpenNoteScanner/blob/master/app/src/main/java/com/todobom/opennotescanner/views/TouchImageView.java

Do you think the use of setImageURI() will affect OpenNoteScanner's performance? If so, maybe we should move Bitmap reading and decoding to a background thread.

Thanks.

title: App Crashed when "Storage" permission is revoked.
body:
When the "Storage" permission is revoked ("Camera" permission is granted) the app crashes. (see the gif below).

(Android 5, Nexus 5, API 23)
![ezgif com-optimize](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11197005/22898369/e572af7e-f1db-11e6-8b3a-64de2ed7ffa7.gif)

IMHO, the APIs for checking(checkSelfPermission) Storage permission should get called just before saving the picture.

title: takePicture fail when autofocus is being accessed multiple times
body:
This error sometimes will pop up and crash the app. After digging around, I found out that certain devices autofocus multiple times during camera startup, in this case, Samsung phones.

The possible solution is to add a flag to check whether autofocus is in progress, if it is, just skip the takePicture function, otherwise, proceed.

Refer to here: http://stackoverflow.com/a/36478131

title: App Status
body:
__Is the application still in development?__

The idea behind the application is really brilliant but the app does not seem to evolve. I have found all the issues that have been reported one year ago.

The most important are:

  - Bad quality;
  - Document recognition failure;
  - PDF template icons unmanaged.

Thank you so much for work you've done!
Mimmo

title: Icons and dimensions of page template
body:
Is it possible to get the icons and the dimensions of the page template so I can create a bigger template?
Does it meet any specification on icon size percentage base on the paper dimension? 

Or at least have another A4 page template with let's say A4 one page?

Regards.

title: Possibility to update images based on same page?
body:
Hello guys! 

First of all I want to say CONGRATS on this great app.

I know that you're working on current features to be stable and fully working in order to process more features but I'd like to point out a new possible feature that will be update the image if we make changes on the page.

Eg. I draw a circle on a page and I process it with the app, once I draw a triangle on the same paper sheet it would automatically update existing and processed image(I guess it would take a reprocessing of the image) . 

Regards.

title: Aggressive post processing
body:
Hi

I like this app because I can use as camera replacement for scanning documents but for that purpose I find the post processing on images to be super aggressive such that most of the images I take with it are not even readable at all, fonts are gone, images are gone etc. I even tried the color mode, but that just gave the same result as the bw mode not sure if it is buggy.  I tried the auto on off without any success.

Anyways it would be great if one could levrage the level of the processing a bit.If people want super auto mode that is fine but I personally like to use this to scan documents, receipts, napkin notes etc

I use the latest Fdroid version on CM12

thanks

title: Handle apps that passes content provider URI
body:
Problem explainded by @mimiks at https://github.com/ctodobom/OpenNoteScanner/issues/33#issuecomment-216953273:

> Some apps may provide an URI that refers to a content provider rather than a file. In that case, the URI scheme starts with content:// rather than file:// and fileUri.getPath()(line 870) will not return a file path.
> 
> A comprehensive example of how to get the path from file-based content providers can be found here: [FileUtils.java](https://github.com/iPaulPro/aFileChooser/blob/master/aFileChooser/src/com/ipaulpro/afilechooser/utils/FileUtils.java)

title: mention location of stored files
body:
I'm having a hard time right now finding out where the stored images are.

I expected to have a "details" view or something on each image.  Or a settings dialogue where I can see the storage path.

title: Wrongly asks for READ_PHONE_STATE permission
body:
It was unintentional, placed on the manifest by Android Studio

Reported on a comment by Rapunsel Jensen on the Linux Magazine article ( http://goo.gl/xWdqJD )

Need removal of the permission

title: Does not detect the note
body:
Hi

When I focus the note and press the shutter button, noting happens. It never detects the note.
I captured some [logs](http://pastebin.com/Rsp15zKW)

App version: 1.0.19
Android version: 5.1

title: Create a better icon and banner
label: [Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
The current Icon / Logo is a mockup of three different icons. The Google Play banner is very amateur.

It is needed to create a new High Resolution logo (512 x 512) as well as the application Icon on all its versions mdpi to xxxhdpi mipmaps, and maybe a vector drawable one.

The Google Play banner would be nice to improve too. The official size is 1024 x 500 px and it would be featured on the initial page of the project too.

Obviously to say that the Green color used in the app must be the main one used on the arts (#00E676).

title: Fail to open large image from the gallery
body:
In some phones an out-of-memory error occurs when trying to open a large image from the gallery, or navigate sliding the fullscreen viewer to a large image.

This error occurs on phones where the OpenGL surface allows 4096x4096 images.

title: Feature request: manual edition
label: [Label(name="Intended feature")]
body: I'd like an option to manually cut the photo and adapt it to the size of my screen. This is very useful if you take a photo with an angle or you just need a paragraph from an entire page.

title: Black image on some devices
body:
Tested only on Galaxy Nexus running CM 12.1, when the app calls  `mCamera.setPreviewDisplay(mSurfaceHolder);` logcat issues the following lines:

```
03-28 09:54:21.849 560-883/com.todobom.opennotescanner W/CameraBase: Camera service died!
03-28 09:54:21.850 560-585/com.todobom.opennotescanner W/CameraBase: mediaserver's remote binder Camera object died
03-28 09:54:29.114 560-560/com.todobom.opennotescanner E/Camera: Error 100
```

title: Autofocus removed support for +200 devices
body: The release 1.0.16.1 introduced autofocus management on the main activity, it is needed to introduce also manual focus to remove autofocus as a requirement.

title: feature request. Process existing files
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Sometimes I have photos of interesting document and have no original paper. Is it possible to see ability work with existing photos in this application?

title: feature request. Merge few images into one pdf
body: I used ImageMagick's convert utility before for processing multipage documents with morphology and merging to pdf. That useful, but requires an regular OS, but it would be great to do all operations instantly inside your app.

title: feature request. Detect book pages
body:
It would be great to detect two book pages on contrast surface and split them up and store both of them into two separate files.

image for example:
![p60322-173917](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17784709/13955334/aa78d27a-f05d-11e5-8065-904512f53978.jpg)

title: Nexus 7 (2013) no focus (auto or manual)
body: When I'm trying to take photo of some document I can't capture it properly because I can't focus it properly. It is just stuck on one level and larger documents are often blurry and text is not recognised

title: Can't install on Android 4.2.2 phone
body:
Hi,

I just wanted to try the latest release and copied the APK to my Android 4.2.2 phone.
When I try to open the APK it says "can't parse file". Any idea why that is?
Is it even compatible with Android 4.2.2?

Greetings

title: should i be able to download/build dependencies w/single command?
body:
Hi, I'm using `gradle --version` `2.10`, and trying to figure out how to build this project and its dependencies. Do these issues sound specific to gradle version or some step I'm missing/didn't see in the README?

I get the following (regardless of arguments) when calling `./gradlew`:

``` sh
Error: Could not find or load main class org.gradle.wrapper.GradleWrapperMain
```

and when I run my own gradle (2.10):

``` sh
ANDROID_HOME=/path/to/my/sdk gradle assembleDebug
```

I get: https://dpaste.de/juge/raw/ **tl;dr** "can't find java libraries" eg: `FullScreenViewActivity.java:8: error: package android.support.v4.app does not exist`

I seem to recall gradle does this automagically as needed. Are these dependencies just not declared in a `build.gradle` somewhere or am I misunderstanding?

title: Gallery selection doesn't show correct after scroll
body: When scrolling the gallery with some selected items, new items appears as selected.

title: Handle better when trying to install downloaded OpenCV apk
body:

title: [Enhancement] Detect and fix folds
body:
When a paper has been folded in two or four, it can be hard to make it flat.
That results in non-rectangle shapes, that could maybe be detected and corrected?
Very low priority.
![tmp_15036-screenshot_2016-03-01-01-46-58-1848968473](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/99590/13401548/e36dd5d6-df4f-11e5-9b8d-6340e4f585fc.png)

title: Gallery showing random pixels
body:
![tmp_8705-screenshot_2016-03-01-01-03-1540948421](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/99590/13400590/dabc19e2-df4b-11e5-848b-b95e663c27ed.png)

After installing for the first time right now from f-droid. Only one picture taken.
Rooted Nexus 5, Android 5.1.1

title: Screen lagging on preview and capture
body:
Due to the fact that all the processing are done in the UI thread, screen lags when the application is searching for the document and also when processing the higher resolution image captured.

Is needed to separate this processing from the UI thread, making it more smooth.

title: Can't Build
body:
If I import to AndroidStudio I get this message:
Error Loading Project: Cannot load 2 modules Details...
and it does not use gradle.
If I click on "Details" I get
Error
2 modules cannot be loaded. You can remove them from the project (no files will be deleted).
OpenNoteScanner: Cannot load module file: '~/AndroidProjects/OpenNoteScanner/OpenNoteScaner.iml'

app: '~/AndroidProjects/OpenNoteScanner/app/app.iml'

Could you please help me?

title: Nexus 5X Orientation
body: The camera orientation is incorrect on the Nexus 5X. This is caused by not using the latest camera APIs for Android.

title: Gallery looks strange
body:
My gallery in Open Note Scanner looks like this:
![tmp_13297-screenshot_20160227-002415-243840594](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1620034/13368272/29602c88-dce9-11e5-9aac-286d1d839e4e.png)

title: Bad quality?
body:
I managed to get a couple of pictures, but only after turning on the flash (maybe you shoud lower the contrast treshold).
Anyway, the captured pictures are at very low resolution and the text is unreadable (11pt on A4, fairly standard).
Am i missing something?

http://www.imagebam.com/image/3ec443467689862

title: Won't capture images
body:
Hi. I'm a big fan of camscanner so when I saw you had a FOSS app that did something similar I was super excited.

I have a Sony Xperia Z1 compact with Android 5.11 - stock rom.

I installed v1.0.10 OpenNoteScanner from f-droid, and let the app install openCV manager from google play. When I launch the app I get the camera preview, I can toggle the buttons on the right, but I can't capture anything. I have tried tapping the blue shutter icon and the screen, and the feedback indicates it registers taps, but nothing happens. 

Any ideas? 

Thanks

title: [Request] Provide apk binary
body:
I have been looking for such an open-source application and would like to test yours. Would you please provide the apk binary in the “Releases” section or publish your app to F-Droid?

Thank you.
